meanings.definition: The early part of the day; morning.
meanings.sent1: Every morn, the sun rises in the sky.
meanings.sent2: I love watching the birds sing in the morn.
meanings.sent3: In the morn, the sleepy cat yawned and stretched.
meanings.sent4: The morn painted the sky with hues of pink and orange.
meanings.sent5: The morn dew glistened on the grass like tiny diamonds.

meanings.sent1: She would morn the loss of her favorite toy.
meanings.sent2: The family gathered to morn the passing of their beloved pet.
meanings.sent3: He would morn over burnt toast as if it were a tragedy.
meanings.sent4: The old tree seemed to morn the loss of its fallen branches.
meanings.sent5: Her heart would morn the absence of his laughter.
